page.title: 18Mining
page.content: During the recent Miners Strike, it was reported that about 30 miners lived in the Manor/Woodthorpe Areas. There is plenty of evidence around to show that mining used to take place in this area. In fact, many people dig coal or shale in their garden, but not enough to use as fuel. There are several "pit-hills", and disused mineshafts have caused one or two near-accidents. There used to be many pits in this area, and local records show that many miners used to live here. Woodthorpe Colliery closed in 1921, after 70 years working, and up to 300 men were employed there. It is now against the law to burn coal in this area. It was made a Smokeless Zone to make the area cleaner and healthier.
